1. Prepare PCR reactions \("aqueous phase") on ice in a total volume of 100µl using 1X Phusion HF buffer, an additional 1mM MgCl<sub>2</sub> , 250 µM dNTPs, 1µM outside primers and 10nM fusion PCR primer, 200 ng genomic DNA and 16 units Phusion polymerase.

2. Put 200 µl oil phase \(4.5% v/v Span 80, 0.4% v/v Tween 80 and 0.05% Triton X-100 dissolved in light mineral oil) in a 2 ml Cryo-Vial and stirring at 1000 rpm with a magnetic bar \(8 x 3mm with a pivot ring).
Add 1 drop of aqueous phase to oil phase every 5 seconds and continue stirring for 5 minutes after addition of the first drop.
4. Transfer 125 µl of emulsion to a clean 200 µl, thin wall PCR tube and overlay with 1 drop of mineral oil.
Run standard Phusion polymerase PCR cycle.
Transfer completed PCR reactions to a 1.5 ml tube and add 400 µl hexane.
Vortex thoroughly and centrifuge at full speed for 3 minutes.
Remove and discard hexane layer \(upper layer).
PAUSE POINT: reactions can be stored at -20 <sup>o</sup>C for several days.
Dilute PCR products 100x with water and reamplify in solution omitting the fusion primer.
Separate PCR products using gel electrophoresis.
